result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant's Motion to Suppress Fruits of Illegal Detention (and Frisk)filed by Atty Steven Richards.
Arraignment on March 7, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:15 PM Attorney Steven G. Richards appeared by video means for Defendant Aaron E Simpson.  Defendant Aaron E Simpson appeared by video means. Attorney Emily Margaret Nelson in court for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Matter set for PH.  State called Officer Lihrman.   Oath admin.   2:19 PM Record reflected witness identified DE.   State offered a certified copy of the Chippewa County JOC.  No obj.  Court received.   2:26 PM  Cross.  2:27 PM Witness excused.   Court finds PC and binds DE over for trial.  ARGN set for 3/7/22 at 1:00 PM.  Adj. 2:28 PM.

Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.    No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  DE must reside at the address on Cty O in Bruce. No contact with MP.
Preliminary hearing on February 2, 2022 at 02:15 pm.

02:14 PM Defendant Aaron E Simpson in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Aaron E Simpson in custody.  Emily Margaret Nelson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Aaron E Simpson appeared by video means with Attorney.  State canceled the officer for PH as no counsel was appointed as of 5:00PM last night.  Atty would like to address bond.  DE currently on a cash bond that he cannot post, asks for the court to modify to sign bond. DOC agent is actively searching for treatment for DE but has been unable to find any availability for openings.  The State objects, DE has been sitting on a probaton hold, DE has no residence, employment or transportation, asks that the cash bond remain.   Atty would like a breakout room.  Back on the record @ 2:22pm.  Atty informs DE is on a sanction until February 5, states DE does have housing, believes he can find employment, asks for sign bond.  

Court will modify bond to $2500.00 sign bond,   Defendant is not to consume or possess alcohol.  Do not enter premises where alcohol is primary business, any bars taverns or liquor stores or any other establishment where the primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.   No possession/consumption or use of illegal or illicit drugs, or any substance intended to use to alter mental state or mood.  Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  No possession of medications not prescribed to you by a physician.  DE must reside at the address on Cty O in Bruce.  No contact with MP.  Set for PH February 2, 2022 @ 2:15PM.  Adj 2:27PM.
